body_html: I am able to use the static c++ tensorflow library in a standalone C++ program but not able to use the static library in a qmake project to use that standalone program in other files! I am encountering the error No session factory registered for the given session options on running the successfully compiled program using qmake. I am using the linker options for -Wl,--allow-multiple-definition, -Wl,--whole-archive but to no effect. Also, if it helps, I am able to use the static library in a standalone program without using these linker options.

Also, if it helps, I am able to use the static library in a standalone program without using these linker options.
body: I am able to use the static c++ tensorflow library in a standalone C++ program but not able to use the static library in a `qmake` project to use that standalone program in other files! I am encountering the error ` No session factory registered for the given session options` on running the successfully compiled program using `qmake`. I am using the linker options for  `-Wl,--allow-multiple-definition, -Wl,--whole-archive` but to no effect. Also, if it helps, I am able to use the static library in a standalone program without using these linker options.
